item.title: Introduction with docker buildx for multiple CPU architecture development.
item.description: A new update here: learning/devops/cross_compilation/dockerized/0000_first_try.md Here I introduce the new docker desktop feature which integrated with qemu and docker buildx command. Now we can build applications in docker images executed with different CPU architectures and run them above operation system with docker environment installed.

item.title: First try to development with ARM docker container[Experimental Feature]
item.description: Build once, run everywhere. Like Java language. Here comes a convenient way to write and deploy application with multiple CPU archtecture articultures attributed by integrated dockerized environments: Docker Desktop(after v2.1.0) Prepare Docker environment: The environment in this demo I prepared: host os: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6 docker environment: integrated in docker desktop v2.1.0.5 (you can check stable release here:link) Here we need to use docker buildx command, which is provided by docker desktop after v2.
